title: Andre Hiwatig
text:
Andre Hiwatig is a senior at University of California, Los Angeles, studying Statistics and Data Science. In his spare time, Andre enjoys many creative pursuits in design and art, which he likes implementing into his work.
Download my resume here

title: Latine Subgroup Analysis
text: This report looks at various data about Latine students living on in UCLA dormitories from 2021-24. We utilized responses to Rate the Hill 2023-24 along with demographic data from the 2021-22, 2022-23, and 2023-24 UCLA academic years. This report further aggregates data about Latine students into smaller subgroups: Mexican and non-Mexican in order to understand deeper nuances between ethnic identities.

title: Demand Transference Accelerator
text: I explored sales of different candy products across international markets to understand the dynamics of demand transference of Mars Wrigley products.

title: Project 3
text: asdf

title: Latine Subgroup Analysis
text: This report looks at various data about Latine students living on in UCLA dormitories from 2021-24. We utilized responses to Rate the Hill 2023-24 along with demographic data from the 2021-22, 2022-23, and 2023-24 UCLA academic years. This report further aggregates data about Latine students into smaller subgroups: Mexican and non-Mexican in order to understand deeper nuances between ethnic identities.

title: Latine Subgroup Analysis
text:
Tools Used
R, Tableau

title: Latine Subgroup Analysis
text:
Summary of Findings

Latine students attend floor and Hill events more often compared to Non-Latine students.
Latine students discussed academic work or research outside of class with people different than them less than Non-Latine students.
Mexican students engaged in discussions with others different than them less often than their Non-Mexican counterparts.

Code omitted per company policy

title: Demand Transference Accelerator
text: I explored sales of different candy products across international markets to understand the dynamics of demand transference of Mars Wrigley products.

title: Demand Transference Accelerator
text:
Tools Used
Python, PySpark, PowerBI

title: Demand Transference Accelerator
text:
Summary of Findings

Product brand was a strong indicator of transference in chocolate products.
Random forest model optimized accelerator run time by 50%.

Code omitted per company policy

title: Demand Transference Accelerator
text:
Process

Encoded 40+ features using domain knowledge about market categories
Filtering and aggregating over 1 billion rows of product sales data
Feature engineered for model efficiency
Calculated product similarities for all retailer purchases
Presented predicted demand transference values to international stakeholders

title: Latine Subgroup Analysis

title: Latine Subgroup Analysis
text:
Process

Filtered data from three years of student surveys and standardized columns
Cleaned text data from free-response questions
Modified dataset for Tableau compatibility
Generated report in Tableau
